definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: To have centralized logging and security.
sentences.chinese: 具有集中的日誌記錄和安全性。

sentences.english: It can also be used to define the default log folder.
sentences.chinese: 還可以使用此屬性來定義缺省日誌文件夾。

sentences.english: After the writer's death, reading his journal is like receiving a long letter.
sentences.chinese: 在作者死亡之後，閱讀他的日誌就想收到了一封長信。

sentences.english: The service should stop its execution because writing to the log fails.
sentences.chinese: 服務將停止執行，因爲此時日誌文件寫入失敗。

sentences.english: Applications should not try to log directly to the network.
sentences.chinese: 應用不應該將日誌直接發到網絡。

sentences.english: Redo logs are needed for recovery.
sentences.chinese: 對於恢復，重做日誌是必需的。

sentences.english: This is because these update operations require synchronous writing to the database log.
sentences.chinese: 原因是這些更新操作都要求同步地寫到數據庫日誌。

sentences.english: The existing log files will be used for rollforward recovery on the source database.
sentences.chinese: 已有的日誌文件將被用於在源數據庫上進行前滾恢復。

sentences.english: You have to check the logs for debugging.
sentences.chinese: 爲了進行調試，必須查看日誌。

sentences.english: Maintains a write-ahead log in a subdirectory of the data directory.
sentences.chinese: 在數據目錄的一個子目錄中維護寫前日誌。

sentences.english: So say ecologists in a commentary in the journalNature.
sentences.chinese: 生態學家在自然日誌的評論中這樣說道。

sentences.english: SQL> drop materialized view log on t_rowid;
sentences.chinese: 實體化視圖日誌已刪除。

sentences.english: Finally, we will code a simple mediation that will enable us to test the log writer.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我們編碼用於測試日誌寫入器的簡單中介。

sentences.english: Here’s the final post with the content automatically inserted.
sentences.chinese: 這是最近一篇內容中自動插入格式的日誌。

sentences.english: This enables the event window to be refreshed whenever messages are logged.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，每當在日誌中記錄消息時，會刷新事件窗口。

sentences.english: Plus, you can get exercise and have your own logbook as a conversation piece.
sentences.chinese: 你可以得到鍛鍊並且成爲你自己的日誌的一部分。

definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
